  8413                     /* If the command is an alias for another
  8414                        (such as lmenu.el set it up), check if the
  8415                        original command matches the cached command.  */
  8416                     && !(SYMBOLP (def)
  8417                          && EQ (tem, XSYMBOL (def)->u.s.function))))
  8418               keys = Qnil;
  8419           }
  8420 
  8421         if (NILP (keys))
  8422           keys = Fwhere_is_internal (def, Qnil, Qt, Qnil, Qnil);
  8423 
  8424         if (!NILP (keys))
  8425           {
  8426             tem = Fkey_description (keys, Qnil);
  8427             if (CONSP (prefix))
  8428               {
  8429                 if (STRINGP (XCAR (prefix)))
  8430                   tem = concat2 (XCAR (prefix), tem);
  8431                 if (STRINGP (XCDR (prefix)))
  8432                   tem = concat2 (tem, XCDR (prefix));
  8433               }
  8434             keyeq = concat2 (space_space, tem);
  8435           }
  8436         else
  8437           keyeq = Qnil;
  8438       }
  8439 
  8440     /* If we have an equivalent key binding, use that.  */
  8441     ASET (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_KEYEQ, keyeq);
  8442   }
  8443 
  8444   /* Include this when menu help is implemented.
  8445   tem = XVECTOR (item_properties)->contents[ITEM_PROPERTY_HELP];
  8446   if (!(NILP (tem) || STRINGP (tem)))
  8447     {
  8448       tem = menu_item_eval_property (tem);
  8449       if (!STRINGP (tem))
  8450         tem = Qnil;
  8451       XVECTOR (item_properties)->contents[ITEM_PROPERTY_HELP] = tem;
  8452     }
  8453   */
  8454 
  8455   /* Handle radio buttons or toggle boxes.  */
  8456   tem = AREF (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_SELECTED);
  8457   if (!NILP (tem))
  8458     ASET (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_SELECTED,
  8459           menu_item_eval_property (tem));
  8460 
  8461   return 1;
  8462 }
  8463 
  8464 
  8465 
  8466 /***********************************************************************
  8467                                Tab-bars
  8468  ***********************************************************************/
  8469 
  8470 /* A vector holding tab bar items while they are parsed in function
  8471    tab_bar_items. Each item occupies TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSCLOTS elements
  8472    in the vector.  */
  8473 
  8474 static Lisp_Object tab_bar_items_vector;
  8475 
  8476 /* A vector holding the result of parse_tab_bar_item.  Layout is like
  8477    the one for a single item in tab_bar_items_vector.  */
  8478 
  8479 static Lisp_Object tab_bar_item_properties;
  8480 
  8481 /* Next free index in tab_bar_items_vector.  */
  8482 
  8483 static int ntab_bar_items;
  8484 
  8485 /* Function prototypes.  */
  8486 
  8487 static void init_tab_bar_items (Lisp_Object);
  8488 static void process_tab_bar_item (Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object,
  8489                                    void *);
  8490 static bool parse_tab_bar_item (Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object);
  8491 static void append_tab_bar_item (void);
  8492 
  8493 
  8494 /* Return a vector of tab bar items for keymaps currently in effect.
  8495    Reuse vector REUSE if non-nil.  Return in *NITEMS the number of
  8496    tab bar items found.  */
  8497 
  8498 Lisp_Object
  8499 tab_bar_items (Lisp_Object reuse, int *nitems)
  8500 {
  8501   Lisp_Object *maps;
  8502   Lisp_Object mapsbuf[3];
  8503   ptrdiff_t nmaps, i;
  8504   Lisp_Object oquit;
  8505   Lisp_Object *tmaps;
  8506   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  8507 
  8508   *nitems = 0;
  8509 
  8510   /* In order to build the menus, we need to call the keymap
  8511      accessors.  They all call maybe_quit.  But this function is called
  8512      during redisplay, during which a quit is fatal.  So inhibit
  8513      quitting while building the menus.  We do this instead of
  8514      specbind because (1) errors will clear it anyway and (2) this
  8515      avoids risk of specpdl overflow.  */
  8516   oquit = Vinhibit_quit;
  8517   Vinhibit_quit = Qt;
  8518 
  8519   /* Initialize tab_bar_items_vector and protect it from GC.  */
  8520   init_tab_bar_items (reuse);
  8521 
  8522   /* Build list of keymaps in maps.  Set nmaps to the number of maps
  8523      to process.  */
  8524 
  8525   /* Should overriding-terminal-local-map and overriding-local-map apply?  */
  8526   if (!NILP (Voverriding_local_map_menu_flag)
  8527       && !NILP (Voverriding_local_map))
  8528     {
  8529       /* Yes, use them (if non-nil) as well as the global map.  */
  8530       maps = mapsbuf;
  8531       nmaps = 0;
  8532       if (!NILP (KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map)))
  8533         maps[nmaps++] = KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map);
  8534       if (!NILP (Voverriding_local_map))
  8535         maps[nmaps++] = Voverriding_local_map;
  8536     }
  8537   else
  8538     {
  8539       /* No, so use major and minor mode keymaps and keymap property.
  8540          Note that tab-bar bindings in the local-map and keymap
  8541          properties may not work reliably, as they are only
  8542          recognized when the tab-bar (or mode-line) is updated,
  8543          which does not normally happen after every command.  */
  8544       ptrdiff_t nminor = current_minor_maps (NULL, &tmaps);
  8545       SAFE_NALLOCA (maps, 1, nminor + 4);
  8546       nmaps = 0;
  8547       Lisp_Object tem = KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map);
  8548       if (!NILP (tem) && !NILP (Voverriding_local_map_menu_flag))
  8549         maps[nmaps++] = tem;
  8550       if (tem = get_local_map (PT, current_buffer, Qkeymap), !NILP (tem))
  8551         maps[nmaps++] = tem;
  8552       if (nminor != 0)
  8553         {
  8554           memcpy (maps + nmaps, tmaps, nminor * sizeof (maps[0]));
  8555           nmaps += nminor;
  8556         }
  8557       maps[nmaps++] = get_local_map (PT, current_buffer, Qlocal_map);
  8558     }
  8559 
  8560   /* Add global keymap at the end.  */
  8561   maps[nmaps++] = current_global_map;
  8562 
  8563   /* Process maps in reverse order and look up in each map the prefix
  8564      key `tab-bar'.  */
  8565   for (i = nmaps - 1; i >= 0; --i)
  8566     if (!NILP (maps[i]))
  8567       {
  8568         Lisp_Object keymap;
  8569 
  8570         keymap = get_keymap (access_keymap (maps[i], Qtab_bar, 1, 0, 1), 0, 1);
  8571         if (CONSP (keymap))
  8572           map_keymap (keymap, process_tab_bar_item, Qnil, NULL, 1);
  8573       }
  8574 
  8575   Vinhibit_quit = oquit;
  8576   *nitems = ntab_bar_items / TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  8577   SAFE_FREE ();
  8578   return tab_bar_items_vector;
  8579 }
  8580 
  8581 
  8582 /* Process the definition of KEY which is DEF.  */
  8583 
  8584 static void
  8585 process_tab_bar_item (Lisp_Object key, Lisp_Object def, Lisp_Object data, void *args)
  8586 {
  8587   int i;
  8588 
  8589   if (EQ (def, Qundefined))
  8590     {
  8591       /* If a map has an explicit `undefined' as definition,
  8592          discard any previously made item.  */
  8593       for (i = 0; i < ntab_bar_items; i += TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8594         {
  8595           Lisp_Object *v = XVECTOR (tab_bar_items_vector)->contents + i;
  8596 
  8597           if (EQ (key, v[TAB_BAR_ITEM_KEY]))
  8598             {
  8599               if (ntab_bar_items > i + TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8600                 memmove (v, v + TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS,
  8601                          ((ntab_bar_items - i - TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8602                           * word_size));
  8603               ntab_bar_items -= TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  8604               break;
  8605             }
  8606         }
  8607     }
  8608   else if (parse_tab_bar_item (key, def))
  8609     /* Append a new tab bar item to tab_bar_items_vector.  Accept
  8610        more than one definition for the same key.  */
  8611     append_tab_bar_item ();
  8612 }
  8613 
  8614 /* Access slot with index IDX of vector tab_bar_item_properties.  */
  8615 #define PROP(IDX) AREF (tab_bar_item_properties, (IDX))
  8616 static void
  8617 set_prop_tab_bar (ptrdiff_t idx, Lisp_Object val)
  8618 {
  8619   ASET (tab_bar_item_properties, idx, val);
  8620 }
  8621 
  8622 
  8623 /* Parse a tab bar item specification ITEM for key KEY and return the
  8624    result in tab_bar_item_properties.  Value is false if ITEM is
  8625    invalid.
  8626 
  8627    ITEM is a list `(menu-item CAPTION BINDING PROPS...)'.
  8628 
  8629    CAPTION is the caption of the item,  If it's not a string, it is
  8630    evaluated to get a string.
  8631 
  8632    BINDING is the tab bar item's binding.  Tab-bar items with keymaps
  8633    as binding are currently ignored.
  8634 
  8635    The following properties are recognized:
  8636 
  8637    - `:enable FORM'.
  8638 
  8639    FORM is evaluated and specifies whether the tab bar item is
  8640    enabled or disabled.
  8641 
  8642    - `:visible FORM'
  8643 
  8644    FORM is evaluated and specifies whether the tab bar item is visible.
  8645 
  8646    - `:filter FUNCTION'
  8647 
  8648    FUNCTION is invoked with one parameter `(quote BINDING)'.  Its
  8649    result is stored as the new binding.
  8650 
  8651    - `:button (TYPE SELECTED)'
  8652 
  8653    TYPE must be one of `:radio' or `:toggle'.  SELECTED is evaluated
  8654    and specifies whether the button is selected (pressed) or not.
  8655 
  8656    - `:image IMAGES'
  8657 
  8658    IMAGES is either a single image specification or a vector of four
  8659    image specifications.  See enum tab_bar_item_images.
  8660 
  8661    - `:help HELP-STRING'.
  8662 
  8663    Gives a help string to display for the tab bar item.
  8664 
  8665    - `:label LABEL-STRING'.
  8666 
  8667    A text label to show with the tab bar button if labels are enabled.  */
  8668 
  8669 static bool
  8670 parse_tab_bar_item (Lisp_Object key, Lisp_Object item)
  8671 {
  8672   Lisp_Object filter = Qnil;
  8673   Lisp_Object caption;
  8674   int i;
  8675 
  8676   /* Definition looks like `(menu-item CAPTION BINDING PROPS...)'.
  8677      Rule out items that aren't lists, don't start with
  8678      `menu-item' or whose rest following `tab-bar-item' is not a
  8679      list.  */
  8680   if (!CONSP (item))
  8681     return 0;
  8682 
  8683   /* As an exception, allow old-style menu separators.  */
  8684   if (STRINGP (XCAR (item)))
  8685     item = list1 (XCAR (item));
  8686   else if (!EQ (XCAR (item), Qmenu_item)
  8687            || (item = XCDR (item), !CONSP (item)))
  8688     return 0;
  8689 
  8690   /* Create tab_bar_item_properties vector if necessary.  Reset it to
  8691      defaults.  */
  8692   if (VECTORP (tab_bar_item_properties))
  8693     {
  8694       for (i = 0; i < TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS; ++i)
  8695         set_prop_tab_bar (i, Qnil);
  8696     }
  8697   else
  8698     tab_bar_item_properties = make_nil_vector (TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS);
  8699 
  8700   /* Set defaults.  */
  8701   set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_KEY, key);
  8702   set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qt);
  8703 
  8704   /* Get the caption of the item.  If the caption is not a string,
  8705      evaluate it to get a string.  If we don't get a string, skip this
  8706      item.  */
  8707   caption = XCAR (item);
  8708   if (!STRINGP (caption))
  8709     {
  8710       caption = menu_item_eval_property (caption);
  8711       if (!STRINGP (caption))
  8712         return 0;
  8713     }
  8714   set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION, caption);
  8715 
  8716   /* If the rest following the caption is not a list, the menu item is
  8717      either a separator, or invalid.  */
  8718   item = XCDR (item);
  8719   if (!CONSP (item))
  8720     {
  8721       if (menu_separator_name_p (SSDATA (caption)))
  8722         {
  8723           set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qnil);
  8724           set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P, Qnil);
  8725           set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION, Qnil);
  8726           return 1;
  8727         }
  8728       return 0;
  8729     }
  8730 
  8731   /* Store the binding.  */
  8732   set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_BINDING, XCAR (item));
  8733   item = XCDR (item);
  8734 
  8735   /* Ignore cached key binding, if any.  */
  8736   if (CONSP (item) && CONSP (XCAR (item)))
  8737     item = XCDR (item);
  8738 
  8739   /* Process the rest of the properties.  */
  8740   FOR_EACH_TAIL (item)
  8741     {
  8742       Lisp_Object ikey = XCAR (item);
  8743       item = XCDR (item);
  8744       if (!CONSP (item))
  8745         break;
  8746       Lisp_Object value = XCAR (item);
  8747 
  8748       if (EQ (ikey, QCenable))
  8749         {
  8750           /* `:enable FORM'.  */
  8751           if (!NILP (Venable_disabled_menus_and_buttons))
  8752             set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qt);
  8753           else
  8754             set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, value);
  8755         }
  8756       else if (EQ (ikey, QCvisible))
  8757         {
  8758           /* `:visible FORM'.  If got a visible property and that
  8759              evaluates to nil then ignore this item.  */
  8760           if (NILP (menu_item_eval_property (value)))
  8761             return 0;
  8762         }
  8763       else if (EQ (ikey, QChelp))
  8764         /* `:help HELP-STRING'.  */
  8765         set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_HELP, value);
  8766       else if (EQ (ikey, QCfilter))
  8767         /* ':filter FORM'.  */
  8768         filter = value;
  8769       else if (EQ (ikey, QCbutton) && CONSP (value))
  8770         {
  8771           /* `:button (TYPE . SELECTED)'.  */
  8772           Lisp_Object type, selected;
  8773 
  8774           type = XCAR (value);
  8775           selected = XCDR (value);
  8776           if (EQ (type, QCtoggle) || EQ (type, QCradio))
  8777             {
  8778               set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P, selected);
  8779             }
  8780         }
  8781     }
  8782 
  8783   /* If got a filter apply it on binding.  */
  8784   if (!NILP (filter))
  8785     set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_BINDING,
  8786               (menu_item_eval_property
  8787                (list2 (filter,
  8788                        list2 (Qquote,
  8789                               PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_BINDING))))));
  8790 
  8791   /* See if the binding is a keymap.  Give up if it is.  */
  8792   if (CONSP (get_keymap (PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_BINDING), 0, 1)))
  8793     return 0;
  8794 
  8795   /* Enable or disable selection of item.  */
  8796   if (!EQ (PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P), Qt))
  8797     set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P,
  8798               menu_item_eval_property (PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P)));
  8799 
  8800   /* Handle radio buttons or toggle boxes.  */
  8801   if (!NILP (PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P)))
  8802     set_prop_tab_bar (TAB_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P,
  8803               menu_item_eval_property (PROP (TAB_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P)));
  8804 
  8805   return 1;
  8806 
  8807 #undef PROP
  8808 }
  8809 
  8810 
  8811 /* Initialize tab_bar_items_vector.  REUSE, if non-nil, is a vector
  8812    that can be reused.  */
  8813 
  8814 static void
  8815 init_tab_bar_items (Lisp_Object reuse)
  8816 {
  8817   if (VECTORP (reuse))
  8818     tab_bar_items_vector = reuse;
  8819   else
  8820     tab_bar_items_vector = make_nil_vector (64);
  8821   ntab_bar_items = 0;
  8822 }
  8823 
  8824 
  8825 /* Append parsed tab bar item properties from
  8826    tab_bar_item_properties */
  8827 
  8828 static void
  8829 append_tab_bar_item (void)
  8830 {
  8831   ptrdiff_t incr
  8832     = (ntab_bar_items
  8833        - (ASIZE (tab_bar_items_vector) - TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS));
  8834 
  8835   /* Enlarge tab_bar_items_vector if necessary.  */
  8836   if (incr > 0)
  8837     tab_bar_items_vector = larger_vector (tab_bar_items_vector, incr, -1);
  8838 
  8839   /* Append entries from tab_bar_item_properties to the end of
  8840      tab_bar_items_vector.  */
  8841   vcopy (tab_bar_items_vector, ntab_bar_items,
  8842          xvector_contents (tab_bar_item_properties), TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS);
  8843   ntab_bar_items += TAB_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  8844 }
  8845 
  8846 
  8847 
  8848 
  8849 
  8850 /***********************************************************************
  8851                                Tool-bars
  8852  ***********************************************************************/
  8853 
  8854 /* A vector holding tool bar items while they are parsed in function
  8855    tool_bar_items. Each item occupies TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSCLOTS elements
  8856    in the vector.  */
  8857 
  8858 static Lisp_Object tool_bar_items_vector;
  8859 
  8860 /* A vector holding the result of parse_tool_bar_item.  Layout is like
  8861    the one for a single item in tool_bar_items_vector.  */
  8862 
  8863 static Lisp_Object tool_bar_item_properties;
  8864 
  8865 /* Next free index in tool_bar_items_vector.  */
  8866 
  8867 static int ntool_bar_items;
  8868 
  8869 /* Function prototypes.  */
  8870 
  8871 static void init_tool_bar_items (Lisp_Object);
  8872 static void process_tool_bar_item (Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object,
  8873                                    void *);
  8874 static bool parse_tool_bar_item (Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object);
  8875 static void append_tool_bar_item (void);
  8876 
  8877 
  8878 /* Return a vector of tool bar items for keymaps currently in effect.
  8879    Reuse vector REUSE if non-nil.  Return in *NITEMS the number of
  8880    tool bar items found.  */
  8881 
  8882 Lisp_Object
  8883 tool_bar_items (Lisp_Object reuse, int *nitems)
  8884 {
  8885   Lisp_Object *maps;
  8886   Lisp_Object mapsbuf[3];
  8887   ptrdiff_t nmaps, i;
  8888   Lisp_Object oquit;
  8889   Lisp_Object *tmaps;
  8890   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  8891 
  8892   *nitems = 0;
  8893 
  8894   /* In order to build the menus, we need to call the keymap
  8895      accessors.  They all call maybe_quit.  But this function is called
  8896      during redisplay, during which a quit is fatal.  So inhibit
  8897      quitting while building the menus.  We do this instead of
  8898      specbind because (1) errors will clear it anyway and (2) this
  8899      avoids risk of specpdl overflow.  */
  8900   oquit = Vinhibit_quit;
  8901   Vinhibit_quit = Qt;
  8902 
  8903   /* Initialize tool_bar_items_vector and protect it from GC.  */
  8904   init_tool_bar_items (reuse);
  8905 
  8906   /* Build list of keymaps in maps.  Set nmaps to the number of maps
  8907      to process.  */
  8908 
  8909   /* Should overriding-terminal-local-map and overriding-local-map apply?  */
  8910   if (!NILP (Voverriding_local_map_menu_flag)
  8911       && !NILP (Voverriding_local_map))
  8912     {
  8913       /* Yes, use them (if non-nil) as well as the global map.  */
  8914       maps = mapsbuf;
  8915       nmaps = 0;
  8916       if (!NILP (KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map)))
  8917         maps[nmaps++] = KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map);
  8918       if (!NILP (Voverriding_local_map))
  8919         maps[nmaps++] = Voverriding_local_map;
  8920     }
  8921   else
  8922     {
  8923       /* No, so use major and minor mode keymaps and keymap property.
  8924          Note that tool-bar bindings in the local-map and keymap
  8925          properties may not work reliably, as they are only
  8926          recognized when the tool-bar (or mode-line) is updated,
  8927          which does not normally happen after every command.  */
  8928       ptrdiff_t nminor = current_minor_maps (NULL, &tmaps);
  8929       SAFE_NALLOCA (maps, 1, nminor + 4);
  8930       nmaps = 0;
  8931       Lisp_Object tem = KVAR (current_kboard, Voverriding_terminal_local_map);
  8932       if (!NILP (tem) && !NILP (Voverriding_local_map_menu_flag))
  8933         maps[nmaps++] = tem;
  8934       if (tem = get_local_map (PT, current_buffer, Qkeymap), !NILP (tem))
  8935         maps[nmaps++] = tem;
  8936       if (nminor != 0)
  8937         {
  8938           memcpy (maps + nmaps, tmaps, nminor * sizeof (maps[0]));
  8939           nmaps += nminor;
  8940         }
  8941       maps[nmaps++] = get_local_map (PT, current_buffer, Qlocal_map);
  8942     }
  8943 
  8944   /* Add global keymap at the end.  */
  8945   maps[nmaps++] = current_global_map;
  8946 
  8947   /* Process maps in reverse order and look up in each map the prefix
  8948      key `tool-bar'.  */
  8949   for (i = nmaps - 1; i >= 0; --i)
  8950     if (!NILP (maps[i]))
  8951       {
  8952         Lisp_Object keymap;
  8953 
  8954         keymap = get_keymap (access_keymap (maps[i], Qtool_bar, 1, 0, 1), 0, 1);
  8955         if (CONSP (keymap))
  8956           map_keymap (keymap, process_tool_bar_item, Qnil, NULL, 1);
  8957       }
  8958 
  8959   Vinhibit_quit = oquit;
  8960   *nitems = ntool_bar_items / TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  8961   SAFE_FREE ();
  8962   return tool_bar_items_vector;
  8963 }
  8964 
  8965 
  8966 /* Process the definition of KEY which is DEF.  */
  8967 
  8968 static void
  8969 process_tool_bar_item (Lisp_Object key, Lisp_Object def, Lisp_Object data, void *args)
  8970 {
  8971   int i;
  8972 
  8973   if (EQ (def, Qundefined))
  8974     {
  8975       /* If a map has an explicit `undefined' as definition,
  8976          discard any previously made item.  */
  8977       for (i = 0; i < ntool_bar_items; i += TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8978         {
  8979           Lisp_Object *v = XVECTOR (tool_bar_items_vector)->contents + i;
  8980 
  8981           if (EQ (key, v[TOOL_BAR_ITEM_KEY]))
  8982             {
  8983               if (ntool_bar_items > i + TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8984                 memmove (v, v + TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS,
  8985                          ((ntool_bar_items - i - TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS)
  8986                           * word_size));
  8987               ntool_bar_items -= TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  8988               break;
  8989             }
  8990         }
  8991     }
  8992   else if (parse_tool_bar_item (key, def))
  8993     /* Append a new tool bar item to tool_bar_items_vector.  Accept
  8994        more than one definition for the same key.  */
  8995     append_tool_bar_item ();
  8996 }
  8997 
  8998 /* Access slot with index IDX of vector tool_bar_item_properties.  */
  8999 #define PROP(IDX) AREF (tool_bar_item_properties, (IDX))
  9000 static void
  9001 set_prop (ptrdiff_t idx, Lisp_Object val)
  9002 {
  9003   ASET (tool_bar_item_properties, idx, val);
  9004 }
  9005 
  9006 
  9007 /* Parse a tool bar item specification ITEM for key KEY and return the
  9008    result in tool_bar_item_properties.  Value is false if ITEM is
  9009    invalid.
  9010 
  9011    ITEM is a list `(menu-item CAPTION BINDING PROPS...)'.
  9012 
  9013    CAPTION is the caption of the item,  If it's not a string, it is
  9014    evaluated to get a string.
  9015 
  9016    BINDING is the tool bar item's binding.  Tool-bar items with keymaps
  9017    as binding are currently ignored.
  9018 
  9019    The following properties are recognized:
  9020 
  9021    - `:enable FORM'.
  9022 
  9023    FORM is evaluated and specifies whether the tool bar item is
  9024    enabled or disabled.
  9025 
  9026    - `:visible FORM'
  9027 
  9028    FORM is evaluated and specifies whether the tool bar item is visible.
  9029 
  9030    - `:filter FUNCTION'
  9031 
  9032    FUNCTION is invoked with one parameter `(quote BINDING)'.  Its
  9033    result is stored as the new binding.
  9034 
  9035    - `:button (TYPE SELECTED)'
  9036 
  9037    TYPE must be one of `:radio' or `:toggle'.  SELECTED is evaluated
  9038    and specifies whether the button is selected (pressed) or not.
  9039 
  9040    - `:image IMAGES'
  9041 
  9042    IMAGES is either a single image specification or a vector of four
  9043    image specifications.  See enum tool_bar_item_images.
  9044 
  9045    - `:help HELP-STRING'.
  9046 
  9047    Gives a help string to display for the tool bar item.
  9048 
  9049    - `:label LABEL-STRING'.
  9050 
  9051    A text label to show with the tool bar button if labels are enabled.  */
  9052 
  9053 static bool
  9054 parse_tool_bar_item (Lisp_Object key, Lisp_Object item)
  9055 {
  9056   Lisp_Object filter = Qnil;
  9057   Lisp_Object caption;
  9058   int i;
  9059   bool have_label = false;
  9060 
  9061   /* Definition looks like `(menu-item CAPTION BINDING PROPS...)'.
  9062      Rule out items that aren't lists, don't start with
  9063      `menu-item' or whose rest following `tool-bar-item' is not a
  9064      list.  */
  9065   if (!CONSP (item))
  9066     return 0;
  9067 
  9068   /* As an exception, allow old-style menu separators.  */
  9069   if (STRINGP (XCAR (item)))
  9070     item = list1 (XCAR (item));
  9071   else if (!EQ (XCAR (item), Qmenu_item)
  9072            || (item = XCDR (item), !CONSP (item)))
  9073     return 0;
  9074 
  9075   /* Create tool_bar_item_properties vector if necessary.  Reset it to
  9076      defaults.  */
  9077   if (VECTORP (tool_bar_item_properties))
  9078     {
  9079       for (i = 0; i < TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS; ++i)
  9080         set_prop (i, Qnil);
  9081     }
  9082   else
  9083     tool_bar_item_properties = make_nil_vector (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS);
  9084 
  9085   /* Set defaults.  */
  9086   set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_KEY, key);
  9087   set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qt);
  9088 
  9089   /* Get the caption of the item.  If the caption is not a string,
  9090      evaluate it to get a string.  If we don't get a string, skip this
  9091      item.  */
  9092   caption = XCAR (item);
  9093   if (!STRINGP (caption))
  9094     {
  9095       caption = menu_item_eval_property (caption);
  9096       if (!STRINGP (caption))
  9097         return 0;
  9098     }
  9099   set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION, caption);
  9100 
  9101   /* If the rest following the caption is not a list, the menu item is
  9102      either a separator, or invalid.  */
  9103   item = XCDR (item);
  9104   if (!CONSP (item))
  9105     {
  9106       if (menu_separator_name_p (SSDATA (caption)))
  9107         {
  9108           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_TYPE, Qt);
  9109 #ifndef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
  9110           /* If we use build_desired_tool_bar_string to render the
  9111              tool bar, the separator is rendered as an image.  */
  9112           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_IMAGES,
  9113                     (menu_item_eval_property
  9114                      (Vtool_bar_separator_image_expression)));
  9115           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qnil);
  9116           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P, Qnil);
  9117           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION, Qnil);
  9118 #endif
  9119           return 1;
  9120         }
  9121       return 0;
  9122     }
  9123 
  9124   /* Store the binding.  */
  9125   set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_BINDING, XCAR (item));
  9126   item = XCDR (item);
  9127 
  9128   /* Ignore cached key binding, if any.  */
  9129   if (CONSP (item) && CONSP (XCAR (item)))
  9130     item = XCDR (item);
  9131 
  9132   /* Process the rest of the properties.  */
  9133   FOR_EACH_TAIL (item)
  9134     {
  9135       Lisp_Object ikey = XCAR (item);
  9136       item = XCDR (item);
  9137       if (!CONSP (item))
  9138         break;
  9139       Lisp_Object value = XCAR (item);
  9140 
  9141       if (EQ (ikey, QCenable))
  9142         {
  9143           /* `:enable FORM'.  */
  9144           if (!NILP (Venable_disabled_menus_and_buttons))
  9145             set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, Qt);
  9146           else
  9147             set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P, value);
  9148         }
  9149       else if (EQ (ikey, QCvisible))
  9150         {
  9151           /* `:visible FORM'.  If got a visible property and that
  9152              evaluates to nil then ignore this item.  */
  9153           if (NILP (menu_item_eval_property (value)))
  9154             return 0;
  9155         }
  9156       else if (EQ (ikey, QChelp))
  9157         /* `:help HELP-STRING'.  */
  9158         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_HELP, value);
  9159       else if (EQ (ikey, QCvert_only))
  9160         /* `:vert-only t/nil'.  */
  9161         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_VERT_ONLY, value);
  9162       else if (EQ (ikey, QClabel))
  9163         {
  9164           const char *bad_label = "!!?GARBLED ITEM?!!";
  9165           /* `:label LABEL-STRING'.  */
  9166           set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_LABEL,
  9167                     STRINGP (value) ? value : build_string (bad_label));
  9168           have_label = true;
  9169         }
  9170       else if (EQ (ikey, QCfilter))
  9171         /* ':filter FORM'.  */
  9172         filter = value;
  9173       else if (EQ (ikey, QCbutton) && CONSP (value))
  9174         {
  9175           /* `:button (TYPE . SELECTED)'.  */
  9176           Lisp_Object type, selected;
  9177 
  9178           type = XCAR (value);
  9179           selected = XCDR (value);
  9180           if (EQ (type, QCtoggle) || EQ (type, QCradio))
  9181             {
  9182               set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P, selected);
  9183               set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_TYPE, type);
  9184             }
  9185         }
  9186       else if (EQ (ikey, QCimage)
  9187                && (CONSP (value)
  9188                    || (VECTORP (value) && ASIZE (value) == 4)))
  9189         /* Value is either a single image specification or a vector
  9190            of 4 such specifications for the different button states.  */
  9191         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_IMAGES, value);
  9192       else if (EQ (ikey, QCrtl))
  9193         /* ':rtl STRING' */
  9194         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_RTL_IMAGE, value);
  9195     }
  9196 
  9197 
  9198   if (!have_label)
  9199     {
  9200       /* Try to make one from caption and key.  */
  9201       Lisp_Object tkey = PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_KEY);
  9202       Lisp_Object tcapt = PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION);
  9203       const char *label = SYMBOLP (tkey) ? SSDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (tkey)) : "";
  9204       const char *capt = STRINGP (tcapt) ? SSDATA (tcapt) : "";
  9205       ptrdiff_t max_lbl_size =
  9206         2 * max (0, min (tool_bar_max_label_size, STRING_BYTES_BOUND / 2)) + 1;
  9207       char *buf = xmalloc (max_lbl_size);
  9208       Lisp_Object new_lbl;
  9209       ptrdiff_t caption_len = strnlen (capt, max_lbl_size);
  9210 
  9211       if (0 < caption_len && caption_len < max_lbl_size)
  9212         {
  9213           strcpy (buf, capt);
  9214           while (caption_len > 0 && buf[caption_len - 1] == '.')
  9215             caption_len--;
  9216           buf[caption_len] = '\0';
  9217           label = capt = buf;
  9218         }
  9219 
  9220       ptrdiff_t label_len = strnlen (label, max_lbl_size);
  9221       if (0 < label_len && label_len < max_lbl_size)
  9222         {
  9223           ptrdiff_t j;
  9224           if (label != buf)
  9225             strcpy (buf, label);
  9226 
  9227           for (j = 0; buf[j] != '\0'; ++j)
  9228             if (buf[j] == '-')
  9229               buf[j] = ' ';
  9230           label = buf;
  9231         }
  9232       else
  9233         label = "";
  9234 
  9235       new_lbl = Fupcase_initials (build_string (label));
  9236       if (SCHARS (new_lbl) <= tool_bar_max_label_size)
  9237         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_LABEL, new_lbl);
  9238       else
  9239         set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_LABEL, empty_unibyte_string);
  9240       xfree (buf);
  9241     }
  9242 
  9243   /* If got a filter apply it on binding.  */
  9244   if (!NILP (filter))
  9245     set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_BINDING,
  9246               (menu_item_eval_property
  9247                (list2 (filter,
  9248                        list2 (Qquote,
  9249                               PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_BINDING))))));
  9250 
  9251   /* See if the binding is a keymap.  Give up if it is.  */
  9252   if (CONSP (get_keymap (PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_BINDING), 0, 1)))
  9253     return 0;
  9254 
  9255   /* If there is a key binding, add it to the help, which will be
  9256      displayed as a tooltip for this entry. */
  9257   Lisp_Object binding = PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_BINDING);
  9258   Lisp_Object keys = Fwhere_is_internal (binding, Qnil, Qt, Qnil, Qnil);
  9259   if (!NILP (keys))
  9260     {
  9261       AUTO_STRING (beg, "  (");
  9262       AUTO_STRING (end, ")");
  9263       Lisp_Object orig = PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_HELP);
  9264       Lisp_Object desc = Fkey_description (keys, Qnil);
  9265 
  9266       if (NILP (orig))
  9267         orig = PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_CAPTION);
  9268 
  9269       set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_HELP, CALLN (Fconcat, orig, beg, desc, end));
  9270     }
  9271 
  9272   /* Enable or disable selection of item.  */
  9273   if (!EQ (PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P), Qt))
  9274     set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P,
  9275               menu_item_eval_property (PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_ENABLED_P)));
  9276 
  9277   /* Handle radio buttons or toggle boxes.  */
  9278   if (!NILP (PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P)))
  9279     set_prop (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P,
  9280               menu_item_eval_property (PROP (TOOL_BAR_ITEM_SELECTED_P)));
  9281 
  9282   return 1;
  9283 
  9284 #undef PROP
  9285 }
  9286 
  9287 
  9288 /* Initialize tool_bar_items_vector.  REUSE, if non-nil, is a vector
  9289    that can be reused.  */
  9290 
  9291 static void
  9292 init_tool_bar_items (Lisp_Object reuse)
  9293 {
  9294   if (VECTORP (reuse))
  9295     tool_bar_items_vector = reuse;
  9296   else
  9297     tool_bar_items_vector = make_nil_vector (64);
  9298   ntool_bar_items = 0;
  9299 }
  9300 
  9301 
  9302 /* Append parsed tool bar item properties from
  9303    tool_bar_item_properties */
  9304 
  9305 static void
  9306 append_tool_bar_item (void)
  9307 {
  9308   ptrdiff_t incr
  9309     = (ntool_bar_items
  9310        - (ASIZE (tool_bar_items_vector) - TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS));
  9311 
  9312   /* Enlarge tool_bar_items_vector if necessary.  */
  9313   if (incr > 0)
  9314     tool_bar_items_vector = larger_vector (tool_bar_items_vector, incr, -1);
  9315 
  9316   /* Append entries from tool_bar_item_properties to the end of
  9317      tool_bar_items_vector.  */
  9318   vcopy (tool_bar_items_vector, ntool_bar_items,
  9319          xvector_contents (tool_bar_item_properties), TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS);
  9320   ntool_bar_items += TOOL_BAR_ITEM_NSLOTS;
  9321 }
  9322 
  9323 
  9324 
  9325 
  9326 
  9327 /* Read a character using menus based on the keymap MAP.
  9328    Return nil if there are no menus in the maps.
  9329    Return t if we displayed a menu but the user rejected it.
  9330 
  9331    PREV_EVENT is the previous input event, or nil if we are reading
  9332    the first event of a key sequence.
  9333 
  9334    If USED_MOUSE_MENU is non-null, set *USED_MOUSE_MENU to true
  9335    if we used a mouse menu to read the input, or false otherwise.  If
  9336    USED_MOUSE_MENU is null, don't dereference it.
  9337 
  9338    The prompting is done based on the prompt-string of the map
  9339    and the strings associated with various map elements.
  9340 
  9341    This can be done with X menus or with menus put in the minibuf.
  9342    These are done in different ways, depending on how the input will be read.
  9343    Menus using X are done after auto-saving in read-char, getting the input
  9344    event from Fx_popup_menu; menus using the minibuf use read_char recursively
  9345    and do auto-saving in the inner call of read_char.  */
  9346 
  9347 static Lisp_Object
  9348 read_char_x_menu_prompt (Lisp_Object map,
  9349                          Lisp_Object prev_event, bool *used_mouse_menu)
  9350 {
  9351   if (used_mouse_menu)
  9352     *used_mouse_menu = false;
  9353 
  9354   /* Use local over global Menu maps.  */
  9355 
  9356   if (! menu_prompting)
  9357     return Qnil;
  9358 
  9359   /* If we got to this point via a mouse click,
  9360      use a real menu for mouse selection.  */
  9361   if (EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (prev_event)
  9362       && !EQ (XCAR (prev_event), Qmenu_bar)
  9363       && !EQ (XCAR (prev_event), Qtab_bar)
  9364       && !EQ (XCAR (prev_event), Qtool_bar))
  9365     {
  9366       /* Display the menu and get the selection.  */
  9367       Lisp_Object value;
  9368 
  9369       value = x_popup_menu_1 (prev_event, get_keymap (map, 0, 1));
  9370       if (CONSP (value))
  9371         {
  9372           Lisp_Object tem;
  9373 
  9374           record_menu_key (XCAR (value));
  9375 
  9376           /* If we got multiple events, unread all but
  9377              the first.
  9378              There is no way to prevent those unread events
  9379              from showing up later in last_nonmenu_event.
  9380              So turn symbol and integer events into lists,
  9381              to indicate that they came from a mouse menu,
  9382              so that when present in last_nonmenu_event
  9383              they won't confuse things.  */
  9384           for (tem = XCDR (value); CONSP (tem); tem = XCDR (tem))
  9385             {
  9386               record_menu_key (XCAR (tem));
  9387               if (SYMBOLP (XCAR (tem))
  9388                   || FIXNUMP (XCAR (tem)))
  9389                 XSETCAR (tem, Fcons (XCAR (tem), Qdisabled));
  9390             }
  9391 
  9392           /* If we got more than one event, put all but the first
  9393              onto this list to be read later.
  9394              Return just the first event now.  */
  9395           Vunread_command_events
  9396             = nconc2 (XCDR (value), Vunread_command_events);
  9397           value = XCAR (value);
  9398         }
  9399       else if (NILP (value))
  9400         value = Qt;
  9401       if (used_mouse_menu)
  9402         *used_mouse_menu = true;
  9403       return value;
  9404     }
  9405   return Qnil ;
  9406 }
  9407 
  9408 static Lisp_Object
  9409 read_char_minibuf_menu_prompt (int commandflag,
  9410                                Lisp_Object map)
  9411 {
  9412   Lisp_Object name;
  9413   ptrdiff_t nlength;
  9414   /* FIXME: Use the minibuffer's frame width.  */
  9415   ptrdiff_t width = FRAME_COLS (SELECTED_FRAME ()) - 4;
  9416   ptrdiff_t idx = -1;
  9417   bool nobindings = true;
  9418   Lisp_Object rest, vector;
  9419   Lisp_Object prompt_strings = Qnil;
  9420 
  9421   vector = Qnil;
  9422 
  9423   if (! menu_prompting)
  9424     return Qnil;
  9425 
  9426   map = get_keymap (map, 0, 1);
  9427   name = Fkeymap_prompt (map);
  9428 
  9429   /* If we don't have any menus, just read a character normally.  */
  9430   if (!STRINGP (name))
  9431     return Qnil;
  9432 
  9433 #define PUSH_C_STR(str, listvar) \
  9434   listvar = Fcons (build_unibyte_string (str), listvar)
  9435 
  9436   /* Prompt string always starts with map's prompt, and a space.  */
  9437   prompt_strings = Fcons (name, prompt_strings);
  9438   PUSH_C_STR (": ", prompt_strings);
  9439   nlength = SCHARS (name) + 2;
  9440 
  9441   rest = map;
  9442 
  9443   /* Present the documented bindings, a line at a time.  */
  9444   while (1)
  9445     {
  9446       bool notfirst = false;
  9447       Lisp_Object menu_strings = prompt_strings;
  9448       ptrdiff_t i = nlength;
  9449       Lisp_Object obj;
  9450       Lisp_Object orig_defn_macro;
  9451 
  9452       /* Loop over elements of map.  */
  9453       while (i < width)
  9454         {
  9455           Lisp_Object elt;
  9456 
  9457           /* FIXME: Use map_keymap to handle new keymap formats.  */
  9458 
  9459           /* At end of map, wrap around if just starting,
  9460              or end this line if already have something on it.  */
  9461           if (NILP (rest))
  9462             {
  9463               if (notfirst || nobindings)
  9464                 break;
  9465               else
  9466                 rest = map;
  9467             }
  9468 
  9469           /* Look at the next element of the map.  */
  9470           if (idx >= 0)
  9471             elt = AREF (vector, idx);
  9472           else
  9473             elt = Fcar_safe (rest);
  9474 
  9475           if (idx < 0 && VECTORP (elt))
  9476             {
  9477               /* If we found a dense table in the keymap,
  9478                  advanced past it, but start scanning its contents.  */
  9479               rest = Fcdr_safe (rest);
  9480               vector = elt;
  9481               idx = 0;
  9482             }
  9483           else
  9484             {
  9485               /* An ordinary element.  */
  9486               Lisp_Object event, tem;
  9487 
  9488               if (idx < 0)
  9489                 {
  9490                   event = Fcar_safe (elt); /* alist */
  9491                   elt = Fcdr_safe (elt);
  9492                 }
  9493               else
  9494                 {
  9495                   XSETINT (event, idx); /* vector */
  9496                 }
  9497 
  9498               /* Ignore the element if it has no prompt string.  */
  9499               if (FIXNUMP (event) && parse_menu_item (elt, -1))
  9500                 {
  9501                   /* True if the char to type matches the string.  */
  9502                   bool char_matches;
  9503                   Lisp_Object upcased_event, downcased_event;
  9504                   Lisp_Object desc = Qnil;
  9505                   Lisp_Object s
  9506                     = AREF (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_NAME);
  9507 
  9508                   upcased_event = Fupcase (event);
  9509                   downcased_event = Fdowncase (event);
  9510                   char_matches = (XFIXNUM (upcased_event) == SREF (s, 0)
  9511                                   || XFIXNUM (downcased_event) == SREF (s, 0));
  9512                   if (! char_matches)
  9513                     desc = Fsingle_key_description (event, Qnil);
  9514 
  9515 #if 0  /* It is redundant to list the equivalent key bindings because
  9516           the prefix is what the user has already typed.  */
  9517                   tem
  9518                     = XVECTOR (item_properties)->contents[ITEM_PROPERTY_KEYEQ];
  9519                   if (!NILP (tem))
  9520                     /* Insert equivalent keybinding.  */
  9521                     s = concat2 (s, tem);
  9522 #endif
  9523                   tem
  9524                     = AREF (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_TYPE);
  9525                   if (EQ (tem, QCradio) || EQ (tem, QCtoggle))
  9526                     {
  9527                       /* Insert button prefix.  */
  9528                       Lisp_Object selected
  9529                         = AREF (item_properties, ITEM_PROPERTY_SELECTED);
  9530                       AUTO_STRING (radio_yes, "(*) ");
  9531                       AUTO_STRING (radio_no , "( ) ");
  9532                       AUTO_STRING (check_yes, "[X] ");
  9533                       AUTO_STRING (check_no , "[ ] ");
  9534                       if (EQ (tem, QCradio))
  9535                         tem = NILP (selected) ? radio_yes : radio_no;
  9536                       else
  9537                         tem = NILP (selected) ? check_yes : check_no;
  9538                       s = concat2 (tem, s);
  9539                     }
  9540 
  9541 
  9542                   /* If we have room for the prompt string, add it to this line.
  9543                      If this is the first on the line, always add it.  */
  9544                   if ((SCHARS (s) + i + 2
  9545                        + (char_matches ? 0 : SCHARS (desc) + 3))
  9546                       < width
  9547                       || !notfirst)
  9548                     {
  9549                       ptrdiff_t thiswidth;
  9550 
  9551                       /* Punctuate between strings.  */
  9552                       if (notfirst)
  9553                         {
  9554                           PUSH_C_STR (", ", menu_strings);
  9555                           i += 2;
  9556                         }
  9557                       notfirst = true;
  9558                       nobindings = false;
  9559 
  9560                       /* If the char to type doesn't match the string's
  9561                          first char, explicitly show what char to type.  */
  9562                       if (! char_matches)
  9563                         {
  9564                           /* Add as much of string as fits.  */
  9565                           thiswidth = min (SCHARS (desc), width - i);
  9566                           menu_strings
  9567                             = Fcons (Fsubstring (desc, make_fixnum (0),
  9568                                                  make_fixnum (thiswidth)),
  9569                                      menu_strings);
  9570                           i += thiswidth;
  9571                           PUSH_C_STR (" = ", menu_strings);
  9572                           i += 3;
  9573                         }
  9574 
  9575                       /* Add as much of string as fits.  */
  9576                       thiswidth = min (SCHARS (s), width - i);
  9577                       menu_strings
  9578                         = Fcons (Fsubstring (s, make_fixnum (0),
  9579                                              make_fixnum (thiswidth)),
  9580                                  menu_strings);
  9581                       i += thiswidth;
  9582                     }
  9583                   else
  9584                     {
  9585                       /* If this element does not fit, end the line now,
  9586                          and save the element for the next line.  */
  9587                       PUSH_C_STR ("...", menu_strings);
  9588                       break;
  9589                     }
  9590                 }
  9591 
  9592               /* Move past this element.  */
  9593               if (idx >= 0 && idx + 1 >= ASIZE (vector))
  9594                 /* Handle reaching end of dense table.  */
  9595                 idx = -1;
  9596               if (idx >= 0)
  9597                 idx++;
  9598               else
  9599                 rest = Fcdr_safe (rest);
  9600             }
  9601         }
  9602 
  9603       /* Prompt with that and read response.  */
  9604       message3_nolog (apply1 (intern ("concat"), Fnreverse (menu_strings)));
  9605 
  9606       /* Make believe it's not a keyboard macro in case the help char
  9607          is pressed.  Help characters are not recorded because menu prompting
  9608          is not used on replay.  */
  9609       orig_defn_macro = KVAR (current_kboard, defining_kbd_macro);
  9610       kset_defining_kbd_macro (current_kboard, Qnil);
  9611       do
  9612         obj = read_char (commandflag, Qnil, Qt, 0, NULL);
  9613       while (BUFFERP (obj));
  9614       kset_defining_kbd_macro (current_kboard, orig_defn_macro);
  9615 
  9616       if (!FIXNUMP (obj) || XFIXNUM (obj) == -2
  9617           || (! EQ (obj, menu_prompt_more_char)
  9618               && (!FIXNUMP (menu_prompt_more_char)
  9619                   || ! BASE_EQ (obj, make_fixnum (Ctl (XFIXNUM (menu_prompt_more_char)))))))
  9620         {
  9621           if (!NILP (KVAR (current_kboard, defining_kbd_macro)))
  9622             store_kbd_macro_char (obj);
  9623           return obj;
  9624         }
  9625       /* Help char - go round again.  */
  9626     }
  9627 }
  9628 
  9629 /* Reading key sequences.  */
  9630 
  9631 static Lisp_Object
  9632 follow_key (Lisp_Object keymap, Lisp_Object key)
  9633 {
  9634   return access_keymap (get_keymap (keymap, 0, 1),
  9635                         key, 1, 0, 1);
  9636 }
  9637 
  9638 static Lisp_Object
  9639 active_maps (Lisp_Object first_event, Lisp_Object second_event)
  9640 {
  9641   Lisp_Object position
  9642     = EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (first_event) ? EVENT_START (first_event) : Qnil;
  9643   /* The position of a click can be in the second event if the first event
  9644      is a fake_prefixed_key like `header-line` or `mode-line`.  */
  9645   if (SYMBOLP (first_event)
  9646       && EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (second_event)
  9647       && EQ (first_event, POSN_POSN (EVENT_START (second_event))))
  9648     {
  9649       eassert (NILP (position));
  9650       position = EVENT_START (second_event);
  9651     }
  9652   return Fcons (Qkeymap, Fcurrent_active_maps (Qt, position));
  9653 }
  9654 
  9655 /* Structure used to keep track of partial application of key remapping
  9656    such as Vfunction_key_map and Vkey_translation_map.  */
  9657 typedef struct keyremap
  9658 {
  9659   /* This is the map originally specified for this use.  */
  9660   Lisp_Object parent;
  9661   /* This is a submap reached by looking up, in PARENT,
  9662      the events from START to END.  */
  9663   Lisp_Object map;
  9664   /* Positions [START, END) in the key sequence buffer
  9665      are the key that we have scanned so far.
  9666      Those events are the ones that we will replace
  9667      if PARENT maps them into a key sequence.  */
  9668   int start, end;
  9669 } keyremap;
  9670 
  9671 /* Lookup KEY in MAP.
  9672    MAP is a keymap mapping keys to key vectors or functions.
  9673    If the mapping is a function and DO_FUNCALL is true,
  9674    the function is called with PROMPT as parameter and its return
  9675    value is used as the return value of this function (after checking
  9676    that it is indeed a vector).  */
  9677 
  9678 static Lisp_Object
  9679 access_keymap_keyremap (Lisp_Object map, Lisp_Object key, Lisp_Object prompt,
  9680                         bool do_funcall)
  9681 {
  9682   Lisp_Object next;
  9683 
  9684   next = access_keymap (map, key, 1, 0, 1);
  9685 
  9686   /* Handle a symbol whose function definition is a keymap
  9687      or an array.  */
  9688   if (SYMBOLP (next) && !NILP (Ffboundp (next))
  9689       && (ARRAYP (XSYMBOL (next)->u.s.function)
  9690           || KEYMAPP (XSYMBOL (next)->u.s.function)))
  9691     next = Fautoload_do_load (XSYMBOL (next)->u.s.function, next, Qnil);
  9692 
  9693   /* If the keymap gives a function, not an
  9694      array, then call the function with one arg and use
  9695      its value instead.  */
  9696   if (do_funcall && FUNCTIONP (next))
  9697     {
  9698       Lisp_Object tem;
  9699       tem = next;
  9700 
  9701       next = call1 (next, prompt);
  9702       /* If the function returned something invalid,
  9703          barf--don't ignore it.  */
  9704       if (! (NILP (next) || VECTORP (next) || STRINGP (next)))
  9705         signal_error ("Function returns invalid key sequence", tem);
  9706     }
  9707   return next;
  9708 }
  9709 
  9710 /* Do one step of the key remapping used for function-key-map and
  9711    key-translation-map:
  9712    KEYBUF is the READ_KEY_ELTS-size buffer holding the input events.
  9713    FKEY is a pointer to the keyremap structure to use.
  9714    INPUT is the index of the last element in KEYBUF.
  9715    DOIT if true says that the remapping can actually take place.
  9716    DIFF is used to return the number of keys added/removed by the remapping.
  9717    PARENT is the root of the keymap.
  9718    PROMPT is the prompt to use if the remapping happens through a function.
  9719    Return true if the remapping actually took place.  */
  9720 
  9721 static bool
  9722 keyremap_step (Lisp_Object *keybuf, volatile keyremap *fkey,
  9723                int input, bool doit, int *diff, Lisp_Object prompt)
  9724 {
  9725   Lisp_Object next, key;
  9726 
  9727   key = keybuf[fkey->end++];
  9728 
  9729   if (KEYMAPP (fkey->parent))
  9730     next = access_keymap_keyremap (fkey->map, key, prompt, doit);
  9731   else
  9732     next = Qnil;
  9733 
  9734   /* If keybuf[fkey->start..fkey->end] is bound in the
  9735      map and we're in a position to do the key remapping, replace it with
  9736      the binding and restart with fkey->start at the end.  */
  9737   if ((VECTORP (next) || STRINGP (next)) && doit)
  9738     {
  9739       int len = XFIXNAT (Flength (next));
  9740       int i;
  9741 
  9742       *diff = len - (fkey->end - fkey->start);
  9743 
  9744       if (READ_KEY_ELTS - input <= *diff)
  9745         error ("Key sequence too long");
  9746 
  9747       /* Shift the keys that follow fkey->end.  */
  9748       if (*diff < 0)
  9749         for (i = fkey->end; i < input; i++)
  9750           keybuf[i + *diff] = keybuf[i];
  9751       else if (*diff > 0)
  9752         for (i = input - 1; i >= fkey->end; i--)
  9753           keybuf[i + *diff] = keybuf[i];
  9754       /* Overwrite the old keys with the new ones.  */
  9755       for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
  9756         keybuf[fkey->start + i]
  9757           = Faref (next, make_fixnum (i));
  9758 
  9759       fkey->start = fkey->end += *diff;
  9760       fkey->map = fkey->parent;
  9761 
  9762       return 1;
  9763     }
  9764 
  9765   fkey->map = get_keymap (next, 0, 1);
  9766 
  9767   /* If we no longer have a bound suffix, try a new position for
  9768      fkey->start.  */
  9769   if (!CONSP (fkey->map))
  9770     {
  9771       fkey->end = ++fkey->start;
  9772       fkey->map = fkey->parent;
  9773     }
  9774   return 0;
  9775 }
  9776 
  9777 static bool
  9778 test_undefined (Lisp_Object binding)
  9779 {
  9780   return (NILP (binding)
  9781           || EQ (binding, Qundefined)
  9782           || (SYMBOLP (binding)
  9783               && EQ (Fcommand_remapping (binding, Qnil, Qnil), Qundefined)));
  9784 }
  9785 
  9786 void init_raw_keybuf_count (void)
  9787 {
  9788   raw_keybuf_count = 0;
  9789 }
  9790 
  9791 /* Read a sequence of keys that ends with a non prefix character,
  9792    storing it in KEYBUF, a buffer of size READ_KEY_ELTS.
  9793    Prompt with PROMPT.
  9794    Return the length of the key sequence stored.
  9795    Return -1 if the user rejected a command menu.
  9796 
  9797    Echo starting immediately unless `prompt' is 0.
  9798 
  9799    If PREVENT_REDISPLAY is non-zero, avoid redisplay by calling
  9800    read_char with a suitable COMMANDFLAG argument.
  9801 
  9802    Where a key sequence ends depends on the currently active keymaps.
  9803    These include any minor mode keymaps active in the current buffer,
  9804    the current buffer's local map, and the global map.
  9805 
  9806    If a key sequence has no other bindings, we check Vfunction_key_map
  9807    to see if some trailing subsequence might be the beginning of a
  9808    function key's sequence.  If so, we try to read the whole function
  9809    key, and substitute its symbolic name into the key sequence.
  9810 
  9811    We ignore unbound `down-' mouse clicks.  We turn unbound `drag-' and
  9812    `double-' events into similar click events, if that would make them
  9813    bound.  We try to turn `triple-' events first into `double-' events,
  9814    then into clicks.
  9815 
  9816    If we get a mouse click in a mode line, vertical divider, or other
  9817    non-text area, we treat the click as if it were prefixed by the
  9818    symbol denoting that area - `mode-line', `vertical-line', or
  9819    whatever.
  9820 
  9821    If the sequence starts with a mouse click, we read the key sequence
  9822    with respect to the buffer clicked on, not the current buffer.
  9823 
  9824    If the user switches frames in the midst of a key sequence, we put
  9825    off the switch-frame event until later; the next call to
  9826    read_char will return it.
  9827 
  9828    If FIX_CURRENT_BUFFER, we restore current_buffer
  9829    from the selected window's buffer.  */
  9830 
  9831 static int
  9832 read_key_sequence (Lisp_Object *keybuf, Lisp_Object prompt,
  9833                    bool dont_downcase_last, bool can_return_switch_frame,
  9834                    bool fix_current_buffer, bool prevent_redisplay)
  9835 {
  9836   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9837 
  9838   /* How many keys there are in the current key sequence.  */
  9839   int t;
  9840 
  9841   /* The length of the echo buffer when we started reading, and
  9842      the length of this_command_keys when we started reading.  */
  9843   ptrdiff_t echo_start UNINIT;
  9844   ptrdiff_t keys_start;
  9845 
  9846   Lisp_Object current_binding = Qnil;
  9847 
  9848   /* Index of the first key that has no binding.
  9849      It is useless to try fkey.start larger than that.  */
  9850   int first_unbound;
  9851 
  9852   /* If t < mock_input, then KEYBUF[t] should be read as the next
  9853      input key.
  9854 
  9855      We use this to recover after recognizing a function key.  Once we
  9856      realize that a suffix of the current key sequence is actually a
  9857      function key's escape sequence, we replace the suffix with the
  9858      function key's binding from Vfunction_key_map.  Now keybuf
  9859      contains a new and different key sequence, so the echo area,
  9860      this_command_keys, and the submaps and defs arrays are wrong.  In
  9861      this situation, we set mock_input to t, set t to 0, and jump to
  9862      restart_sequence; the loop will read keys from keybuf up until
  9863      mock_input, thus rebuilding the state; and then it will resume
  9864      reading characters from the keyboard.  */
  9865   int mock_input = 0;
  9866 
  9867   /* Whether each event in the mocked input came from a mouse menu.  */
  9868   bool used_mouse_menu_history[READ_KEY_ELTS] = {0};
  9869 
  9870   /* If the sequence is unbound in submaps[], then
  9871      keybuf[fkey.start..fkey.end-1] is a prefix in Vfunction_key_map,
  9872      and fkey.map is its binding.
  9873 
  9874      These might be > t, indicating that all function key scanning
  9875      should hold off until t reaches them.  We do this when we've just
  9876      recognized a function key, to avoid searching for the function
  9877      key's again in Vfunction_key_map.  */
  9878   keyremap fkey;
  9879 
  9880   /* Likewise, for key_translation_map and input-decode-map.  */
  9881   keyremap keytran, indec;
  9882 
  9883   /* True if we are trying to map a key by changing an upper-case
  9884      letter to lower case, or a shifted function key to an unshifted
  9885      one.  */
  9886   bool shift_translated = false;
  9887 
  9888   /* If we receive a `switch-frame' or `select-window' event in the middle of
  9889      a key sequence, we put it off for later.
  9890      While we're reading, we keep the event here.  */
  9891   Lisp_Object delayed_switch_frame;
  9892 
  9893   Lisp_Object original_uppercase UNINIT;
  9894   int original_uppercase_position = -1;
  9895 
  9896   /* Gets around Microsoft compiler limitations.  */
  9897   bool dummyflag = false;
  9898 
  9899   struct buffer *starting_buffer;
  9900 
  9901   /* List of events for which a fake prefix key has been generated.  */
  9902   Lisp_Object fake_prefixed_keys = Qnil;
  9903 
  9904   /* raw_keybuf_count is now initialized in (most of) the callers of
  9905      read_key_sequence.  This is so that in a recursive call (for
  9906      mouse menus) a spurious initialization doesn't erase the contents
  9907      of raw_keybuf created by the outer call.  */
  9908   /* raw_keybuf_count = 0; */
  9909 
  9910   delayed_switch_frame = Qnil;
  9911 
  9912   if (INTERACTIVE)
  9913     {
  9914       if (!NILP (prompt))
  9915         {
  9916           /* Install the string PROMPT as the beginning of the string
  9917              of echoing, so that it serves as a prompt for the next
  9918              character.  */
  9919           kset_echo_prompt (current_kboard, prompt);
  9920           /* FIXME: This use of echo_now doesn't look quite right and is ugly
  9921              since it forces us to fiddle with current_kboard->immediate_echo
  9922              before and after.  */
  9923           current_kboard->immediate_echo = false;
  9924           echo_now ();
  9925           if (!echo_keystrokes_p ())
  9926             current_kboard->immediate_echo = false;
  9927         }
  9928       else if (cursor_in_echo_area /* FIXME: Not sure why we test this here,
  9929                                       maybe we should just drop this test.  */
  9930                && echo_keystrokes_p ())
  9931         /* This doesn't put in a dash if the echo buffer is empty, so
  9932            you don't always see a dash hanging out in the minibuffer.  */
  9933         echo_dash ();
  9934     }
  9935 
  9936   /* Record the initial state of the echo area and this_command_keys;
  9937      we will need to restore them if we replay a key sequence.  */
  9938   if (INTERACTIVE)
  9939     echo_start = echo_length ();
  9940   keys_start = this_command_key_count;
  9941   this_single_command_key_start = keys_start;
  9942 
  9943   /* We jump here when we need to reinitialize fkey and keytran; this
  9944      happens if we switch keyboards between rescans.  */
  9945  replay_entire_sequence:
  9946 
  9947   indec.map = indec.parent = KVAR (current_kboard, Vinput_decode_map);
  9948   fkey.map = fkey.parent = KVAR (current_kboard, Vlocal_function_key_map);
  9949   keytran.map = keytran.parent = Vkey_translation_map;
  9950   indec.start = indec.end = 0;
  9951   fkey.start = fkey.end = 0;
  9952   keytran.start = keytran.end = 0;
  9953 
  9954   /* We jump here when the key sequence has been thoroughly changed, and
  9955      we need to rescan it starting from the beginning.  When we jump here,
  9956      keybuf[0..mock_input] holds the sequence we should reread.  */
  9957  replay_sequence:
  9958 
  9959   starting_buffer = current_buffer;
  9960   first_unbound = READ_KEY_ELTS + 1;
  9961   Lisp_Object first_event = mock_input > 0 ? keybuf[0] : Qnil;
  9962   Lisp_Object second_event = mock_input > 1 ? keybuf[1] : Qnil;
  9963 
  9964   /* Build our list of keymaps.
  9965      If we recognize a function key and replace its escape sequence in
  9966      keybuf with its symbol, or if the sequence starts with a mouse
  9967      click and we need to switch buffers, we jump back here to rebuild
  9968      the initial keymaps from the current buffer.  */
  9969   current_binding = active_maps (first_event, second_event);
  9970 
  9971   /* Start from the beginning in keybuf.  */
  9972   t = 0;
  9973   last_nonmenu_event = Qnil;
  9974 
  9975   /* These are no-ops the first time through, but if we restart, they
  9976      revert the echo area and this_command_keys to their original state.  */
  9977   this_command_key_count = keys_start;
  9978   if (INTERACTIVE && t < mock_input)
  9979     echo_truncate (echo_start);
  9980 
  9981   /* If the best binding for the current key sequence is a keymap, or
  9982      we may be looking at a function key's escape sequence, keep on
  9983      reading.  */
  9984   while (!NILP (current_binding)
  9985          /* Keep reading as long as there's a prefix binding.  */
  9986          ? KEYMAPP (current_binding)
  9987          /* Don't return in the middle of a possible function key sequence,
  9988             if the only bindings we found were via case conversion.
  9989             Thus, if ESC O a has a function-key-map translation
  9990             and ESC o has a binding, don't return after ESC O,
  9991             so that we can translate ESC O plus the next character.  */
  9992          : (/* indec.start < t || fkey.start < t || */ keytran.start < t))
  9993     {
  9994       Lisp_Object key;
  9995       bool used_mouse_menu = false;
  9996 
  9997       /* Where the last real key started.  If we need to throw away a
  9998          key that has expanded into more than one element of keybuf
  9999          (say, a mouse click on the mode line which is being treated
 10000          as [mode-line (mouse-...)], then we backtrack to this point
 10001          of keybuf.  */
 10002       int last_real_key_start;
 10003 
 10004       /* These variables are analogous to echo_start and keys_start;
 10005          while those allow us to restart the entire key sequence,
 10006          echo_local_start and keys_local_start allow us to throw away
 10007          just one key.  */
 10008       ptrdiff_t echo_local_start UNINIT;
 10009       int keys_local_start;
 10010       Lisp_Object new_binding;
 10011 
 10012       eassert (indec.end == t || (indec.end > t && indec.end <= mock_input));
 10013       eassert (indec.start <= indec.end);
 10014       eassert (fkey.start <= fkey.end);
 10015       eassert (keytran.start <= keytran.end);
 10016       /* key-translation-map is applied *after* function-key-map
 10017          which is itself applied *after* input-decode-map.  */
 10018       eassert (fkey.end <= indec.start);
 10019       eassert (keytran.end <= fkey.start);
 10020 
 10021       if (/* first_unbound < indec.start && first_unbound < fkey.start && */
 10022           first_unbound < keytran.start)
 10023         { /* The prefix up to first_unbound has no binding and has
 10024              no translation left to do either, so we know it's unbound.
 10025              If we don't stop now, we risk staying here indefinitely
 10026              (if the user keeps entering fkey or keytran prefixes
 10027              like C-c ESC ESC ESC ESC ...)  */
 10028           int i;
 10029           for (i = first_unbound + 1; i < t; i++)
 10030             keybuf[i - first_unbound - 1] = keybuf[i];
 10031           mock_input = t - first_unbound - 1;
 10032           indec.end = indec.start -= first_unbound + 1;
 10033           indec.map = indec.parent;
 10034           fkey.end = fkey.start -= first_unbound + 1;
 10035           fkey.map = fkey.parent;
 10036           keytran.end = keytran.start -= first_unbound + 1;
 10037           keytran.map = keytran.parent;
 10038           goto replay_sequence;
 10039         }
 10040 
 10041       if (t >= READ_KEY_ELTS)
 10042         error ("Key sequence too long");
 10043 
 10044       if (INTERACTIVE)
 10045         echo_local_start = echo_length ();
 10046       keys_local_start = this_command_key_count;
 10047 
 10048     replay_key:
 10049       /* These are no-ops, unless we throw away a keystroke below and
 10050          jumped back up to replay_key; in that case, these restore the
 10051          variables to their original state, allowing us to replay the
 10052          loop.  */
 10053       if (INTERACTIVE && t < mock_input)
 10054         echo_truncate (echo_local_start);
 10055       this_command_key_count = keys_local_start;
 10056 
 10057       /* By default, assume each event is "real".  */
 10058       last_real_key_start = t;
 10059 
 10060       /* Does mock_input indicate that we are re-reading a key sequence?  */
 10061       if (t < mock_input)
 10062         {
 10063           key = keybuf[t];
 10064           add_command_key (key);
 10065           if (current_kboard->immediate_echo)
 10066             {
 10067               /* Set immediate_echo to false so as to force echo_now to
 10068                  redisplay (it will set immediate_echo right back to true).  */
 10069               current_kboard->immediate_echo = false;
 10070               echo_now ();
 10071             }
 10072           used_mouse_menu = used_mouse_menu_history[t];
 10073         }
 10074 
 10075       /* If not, we should actually read a character.  */
 10076       else
 10077         {
 10078           {
 10079             KBOARD *interrupted_kboard = current_kboard;
 10080             struct frame *interrupted_frame = SELECTED_FRAME ();
 10081             /* Calling read_char with COMMANDFLAG = -2 avoids
 10082                redisplay in read_char and its subroutines.  */
 10083             key = read_char (prevent_redisplay ? -2 : NILP (prompt),
 10084                              current_binding, last_nonmenu_event,
 10085                              &used_mouse_menu, NULL);
 10086             used_mouse_menu_history[t] = used_mouse_menu;
 10087             if ((FIXNUMP (key) && XFIXNUM (key) == -2) /* wrong_kboard_jmpbuf */
 10088                 /* When switching to a new tty (with a new keyboard),
 10089                    read_char returns the new buffer, rather than -2
 10090                    (Bug#5095).  This is because `terminal-init-xterm'
 10091                    calls read-char, which eats the wrong_kboard_jmpbuf
 10092                    return.  Any better way to fix this? -- cyd  */
 10093                 || (interrupted_kboard != current_kboard))
 10094               {
 10095                 bool found = false;
 10096                 struct kboard *k;
 10097 
 10098                 for (k = all_kboards; k; k = k->next_kboard)
 10099                   if (k == interrupted_kboard)
 10100                     found = true;
 10101 
 10102                 if (!found)
 10103                   {
 10104                     /* Don't touch interrupted_kboard when it's been
 10105                        deleted.  */
 10106                     delayed_switch_frame = Qnil;
 10107                     goto replay_entire_sequence;
 10108                   }
 10109 
 10110                 if (!NILP (delayed_switch_frame))
 10111                   {
 10112                     kset_kbd_queue
 10113                       (interrupted_kboard,
 10114                        Fcons (delayed_switch_frame,
 10115                               KVAR (interrupted_kboard, kbd_queue)));
 10116                     delayed_switch_frame = Qnil;
 10117                   }
 10118 
 10119                 while (t > 0)
 10120                   kset_kbd_queue
 10121                     (interrupted_kboard,
 10122                      Fcons (keybuf[--t], KVAR (interrupted_kboard, kbd_queue)));
 10123 
 10124                 /* If the side queue is non-empty, ensure it begins with a
 10125                    switch-frame, so we'll replay it in the right context.  */
 10126                 if (CONSP (KVAR (interrupted_kboard, kbd_queue))
 10127                     && (key = XCAR (KVAR (interrupted_kboard, kbd_queue)),
 10128                         !(EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (key)
 10129                           && EQ (EVENT_HEAD_KIND (EVENT_HEAD (key)),
 10130                                  Qswitch_frame))))
 10131                   {
 10132                     Lisp_Object frame;
 10133                     XSETFRAME (frame, interrupted_frame);
 10134                     kset_kbd_queue
 10135                       (interrupted_kboard,
 10136                        Fcons (make_lispy_switch_frame (frame),
 10137                               KVAR (interrupted_kboard, kbd_queue)));
 10138                    mock_input = 0;
 10139                  }
 10140                else
 10141                  {
 10142                    if (FIXNUMP (key) && XFIXNUM (key) != -2)
 10143                      {
 10144                        /* If interrupted while initializing terminal, we
 10145                           need to replay the interrupting key.  See
 10146                           Bug#5095 and Bug#37782.  */
 10147                        mock_input = 1;
 10148                        keybuf[0] = key;
 10149                      }
 10150                    else
 10151                      {
 10152                        mock_input = 0;
 10153                      }
 10154                   }
 10155                 goto replay_entire_sequence;
 10156               }
 10157           }
 10158 
 10159           /* read_char returns t when it shows a menu and the user rejects it.
 10160              Just return -1.  */
 10161           if (EQ (key, Qt))
 10162             {
 10163               unbind_to (count, Qnil);
 10164               return -1;
 10165             }
 10166 
 10167           /* read_char returns -1 at the end of a macro.
 10168              Emacs 18 handles this by returning immediately with a
 10169              zero, so that's what we'll do.  */
 10170           if (FIXNUMP (key) && XFIXNUM (key) == -1)
 10171             {
 10172               t = 0;
 10173               /* The Microsoft C compiler can't handle the goto that
 10174                  would go here.  */
 10175               dummyflag = true;
 10176               break;
 10177             }
 10178 
 10179           /* If the current buffer has been changed from under us, the
 10180              keymap may have changed, so replay the sequence.  */
 10181           if (BUFFERP (key))
 10182             {
 10183               timer_resume_idle ();
 10184 
 10185               mock_input = t;
 10186               /* Reset the current buffer from the selected window
 10187                  in case something changed the former and not the latter.
 10188                  This is to be more consistent with the behavior
 10189                  of the command_loop_1.  */
 10190               if (fix_current_buffer)
 10191                 {
 10192                   if (! FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (selected_frame)))
 10193                     Fkill_emacs (Qnil, Qnil);
 10194                   if (XBUFFER (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents)
 10195                       != current_buffer)
 10196                     Fset_buffer (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents);
 10197                 }
 10198 
 10199               goto replay_sequence;
 10200             }
 10201 
 10202           /* If we have a quit that was typed in another frame, and
 10203              quit_throw_to_read_char switched buffers,
 10204              replay to get the right keymap.  */
 10205           if (FIXNUMP (key)
 10206               && XFIXNUM (key) == quit_char
 10207               && current_buffer != starting_buffer)
 10208             {
 10209               GROW_RAW_KEYBUF;
 10210               ASET (raw_keybuf, raw_keybuf_count, key);
 10211               raw_keybuf_count++;
 10212               keybuf[t++] = key;
 10213               mock_input = t;
 10214               Vquit_flag = Qnil;
 10215               goto replay_sequence;
 10216             }
 10217 
 10218           Vquit_flag = Qnil;
 10219 
 10220           if (EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (key)
 10221               /* Either a `switch-frame' or a `select-window' event.  */
 10222               && EQ (EVENT_HEAD_KIND (EVENT_HEAD (key)), Qswitch_frame))
 10223             {
 10224               /* If we're at the beginning of a key sequence, and the caller
 10225                  says it's okay, go ahead and return this event.  If we're
 10226                  in the midst of a key sequence, delay it until the end.  */
 10227               if (t > 0 || !can_return_switch_frame)
 10228                 {
 10229                   delayed_switch_frame = key;
 10230                   goto replay_key;
 10231                 }
 10232             }
 10233 
 10234           if (NILP (first_event))
 10235             {
 10236               first_event = key;
 10237               /* Even if first_event does not specify a particular
 10238                  window/position, it's important to recompute the maps here
 10239                  since a long time might have passed since we entered
 10240                  read_key_sequence, and a timer (or process-filter or
 10241                  special-event-map, ...) might have switched the current buffer
 10242                  or the selected window from under us in the mean time.  */
 10243               if (fix_current_buffer
 10244                   && (XBUFFER (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents)
 10245                       != current_buffer))
 10246                 Fset_buffer (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents);
 10247               current_binding = active_maps (first_event, Qnil);
 10248             }
 10249 
 10250           GROW_RAW_KEYBUF;
 10251           ASET (raw_keybuf, raw_keybuf_count,
 10252                 /* Copy the event, in case it gets modified by side-effect
 10253                    by some remapping function (bug#30955).  */
 10254                 CONSP (key) ? Fcopy_sequence (key) : key);
 10255           raw_keybuf_count++;
 10256         }
 10257 
 10258       /* Clicks in non-text areas get prefixed by the symbol
 10259          in their CHAR-ADDRESS field.  For example, a click on
 10260          the mode line is prefixed by the symbol `mode-line'.
 10261 
 10262          Furthermore, key sequences beginning with mouse clicks
 10263          are read using the keymaps of the buffer clicked on, not
 10264          the current buffer.  So we may have to switch the buffer
 10265          here.
 10266 
 10267          When we turn one event into two events, we must make sure
 10268          that neither of the two looks like the original--so that,
 10269          if we replay the events, they won't be expanded again.
 10270          If not for this, such reexpansion could happen either here
 10271          or when user programs play with this-command-keys.  */
 10272       if (EVENT_HAS_PARAMETERS (key))
 10273         {
 10274           Lisp_Object kind = EVENT_HEAD_KIND (EVENT_HEAD (key));
 10275           if (EQ (kind, Qmouse_click))
 10276             {
 10277               Lisp_Object window = POSN_WINDOW (EVENT_START (key));
 10278               Lisp_Object posn = POSN_POSN (EVENT_START (key));
 10279 
 10280               if (CONSP (posn)
 10281                   || (!NILP (fake_prefixed_keys)
 10282                       && !NILP (Fmemq (key, fake_prefixed_keys))))
 10283                 {
 10284                   /* We're looking a second time at an event for which
 10285                      we generated a fake prefix key.  Set
 10286                      last_real_key_start appropriately.  */
 10287                   if (t > 0)
 10288                     last_real_key_start = t - 1;
 10289                 }
 10290 
 10291               if (last_real_key_start == 0)
 10292                 {
 10293                   /* Key sequences beginning with mouse clicks are
 10294                      read using the keymaps in the buffer clicked on,
 10295                      not the current buffer.  If we're at the
 10296                      beginning of a key sequence, switch buffers.  */
 10297                   if (WINDOWP (window)
 10298                       && BUFFERP (XWINDOW (window)->contents)
 10299                       && XBUFFER (XWINDOW (window)->contents) != current_buffer)
 10300                     {
 10301                       keybuf[t] = key;
 10302                       mock_input = t + 1;
 10303 
 10304                       /* Arrange to go back to the original buffer once we're
 10305                          done reading the key sequence.  Note that we can't
 10306                          use save_excursion_{save,restore} here, because they
 10307                          save point as well as the current buffer; we don't
 10308                          want to save point, because redisplay may change it,
 10309                          to accommodate a Fset_window_start or something.  We
 10310                          don't want to do this at the top of the function,
 10311                          because we may get input from a subprocess which
 10312                          wants to change the selected window and stuff (say,
 10313                          emacsclient).  */
 10314                       record_unwind_current_buffer ();
 10315 
 10316                       if (! FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (selected_frame)))
 10317                         Fkill_emacs (Qnil, Qnil);
